label: Analytical Lexicon
description: Analytical information includes such things as morphological derivation, grammatically related forms, argument structure, ...

label: Annotation
description: A linguistic annotation is defined as structured linguistic information that is explicitly aligned to some spatial and/or temporal extent of some other linguistic record.

label: Bilingual Lexicon
description: s in another language.

label: Comparative description
description: The resource includes comparative or typological description.

label: Dictionary
description: This includes any resource that lists words or morphemes and defines them. It contrasts with a word list in that the

label: Discourse annotation
description: The resource includes aligned discourse transcription.

label: Discourse dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of discourse data.

label: Discourse description
description: The resource includes description of discourse characteristics.

label: Drama
description: A planned, creative, rendition of discourse with two or more participants.

label: Etymological Lexicon
description: The Lexicon contains etymological information.

label: Formulaic
description: Examples of formulaic discourse are prayers, curses, blessings, charms, curing rituals, marriage vows, and oaths.

label: Frequency Lexicon
description: The Lexicon contains frequency information.

label: Gestural annotation
description: The resource includes gestural annotation.

label: Gestural dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of gestural data.

label: Gestural description
description: The resource includes description of gestural characteristics.

label: Gestural transcription
description: The resource includes gestural transcription.
The resource includes aligned representations of eye, face, and body movements.

label: Kinesic dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of kinesic data.

label: Kinesic description
description: The resource includes description of kinesic characteristics.

label: Kinesic transcription
description: Kinesic transcriptions represent systematic uses of facial expressions, body language, and eye gaze that are used to communicate meaning.

label: Description
description: A description is any description or analysis of a language. Unlike a transcription or an annotation, the structure of a description is independent of the structure of the linguistic events that it describes.

label: Lexicon
description: The resource includes a systematic listing of lexical items.

label: Ludic
description: Examples of ludic discourse are play languages, jokes, secret languages, and speech disguises.

label: Morphological annotation
description: A morphological annotation is a morphological transcription where the component morphemes are aligned with some other linguistic record, such as an orthographic transcription or a speech signal. An example of morphological annotation is interlinear text with aligned morphemic glosses.

label: Morphological dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of morphological data.

label: Morphological description
description: The resource includes description of morphological characteristics.

label: Musical annotation
description: The resource includes musical annotation.

label: Musical dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of musical data.

label: Musical transcription
description: A musical transcription represents music.

label: Narrative
description: Types of narratives include historical, traditional, and personal narratives, myths, folktales, fables, and humorous stories.

label: Oratory
description: Examples of oratory include sermons, lectures, political speeches, and invocations.

label: Orthographic dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of orthographic data.

label: Orthographic description
description: The resource includes documentation of a writing system.

label: Orthographic
description: Examples of Orthographic texts include letters, books, and other written documents

label: Orthographic transcription
description: Orthographic transcriptions differ from phonemic transcriptions that use a practical orthography in that they include orthographic conventions for punctuation, capitalization, etc.

label: Part-of-speech annotation
description: The resource includes aligned part-of-speech tags.

label: Part-of-speech dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of part-of-speech data.

label: Part-of-speech description
description: The resource includes description of part-of-speech characteristics.

label: Pedagogical description
description: A pedagogical description is a style of presentation intended for use in teaching people to use the language.

label: Phonemic transcription
description: Phonemic transcription may use the International Phonetic Alphabet [IPA] or a practical orthography.

label: Phonetic annotation
description: An example of a phonetic annotation is the TIMIT database, in which each element of phonetic transcription is associated with a range of samples in a digital audio file [TIMIT].

label: Phonetic dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of phonetic data.

label: Phonetic description
description: The resource includes description of phonetic characteristics.

label: Phonetic Lexicon
description: The Lexicon contains phonetic information, including pronunciation, phonology, stress, rhymes.

label: Phonetic transcription
description: Phonetic transcription may be narrow or broad, and will typically use the International Phonetic Alphabet [IPA] in a standard encoding (e.g. [Unicode-IPA], [SAMPA]). Phonological transcriptions are also classified here.

label: Phonological dataset
description: Prosodic dataset

label: Phonological description
description: The resource includes descriptionof phonological characteristics.

label: Procedural
description: Examples of procedural discourses include recipes, instructions, and plans.

label: Name Dictionary
description: The resource includes only proper names sa dictionary headwords.

label: Prosodic annotation
description: The resource includes prosodic annotation.

label: Prosodic description
description: The resource includes description of prosodic characteristics.

label: Prosodic transcription
description: A prosodic transcription is a symbolic record of intonation, stress, tone or other suprasegmental features that is expressed independently of regular phonetic transcription.

label: Report
description: Examples of reports include news reports, essays, and commentaries.

label: Semantic dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of semantic data.

label: Semantic description
description: The resource includes description of semantic characteristics.

label: Singing
description: Examples of singing include chants, songs, and choruses.

label: Syntactic annotation
description: A syntactic annotation might include supra-lexical features such as word order or auxiliary phrase constructions. They may thus be aligned with phrases or clauses rather than smaller segments of the annotated record.

label: Syntactic dataset
description: The dataset is comprised of syntactic data.

label: Syntactic description
description: The resource includes description of syntactic characteristics.

label: Terminology
description: A terminological Lexicon is a glossary of domain-specific terms. Examples are technical terminology, kinship terms, color terms, acronyms, ...

label: Text
description: A text is defined as any primary resource or research material, such as a literary work, film, or recording of natural discourse.

label: Thesaurus
description: A thesaurus is a list of words or concepts arranged according to sense.

label: Transcription
description: A resource can be identified as a transcription if it includes a type of transcription as part of the content; for example, the first line of an interlinear analysis is often some type of transcription.

label: Translation
description: Translations may align with different linguistic levels of the resource: morpheme-by-morpheme translation, word-by-word translation, sentence-level free translation, or discourse-level free translation.

label: Unintelligible speech
description: Examples of unintelligible speech include sacred languages, speaking in tongues, and singing syllables (fa-la-la).

label: Word list
description: A word list is a list of reference words in a major language for which the nearest equivalent word in a target language has been elicited (for instance, the Swadesh 100-word list).

label: WordNet
description: Whereas a dictionary documents the meanings of words by means of

label: Annotator
description: The participant produced an annotation of this or a related resource.

label: Author
description: The participant contributed original writings to the resource.

label: Compiler
description: The participant is responsible for collecting the sub-parts of the resource together.

label: Consultant
description: The participant contributes expertise to the creation of a work.

label: Data Inputter
description: The participant was responsible for entering, re-typing, and/or structuring the data contained in the resource.

label: Depositor
description: The participant was responsible for depositing the resource in an archive.

label: Developer
description: The participant developed the methodology or agents that constitute the resource, or that were used to create the resource.

label: Editor
description: The participant reviewed, corrected, and/or tested the resource.

label: Illustrator
description: The participant contributed drawings or other illustrations to the resource.

label: Interpreter
description: The participant translates in real-time or explains the discourse recorded in the resource.

label: Interviewer
description: The participant conducted an interview that forms part of the resource.

label: Participant
description: The participant was present during the creation of the resource, but did not contribute substantially to its content.

label: Performer
description: The participant performed some portion of a recorded, filmed, or transcribed resource.

label: Photographer
description: The participant took the photograph, or shot the film, that appears in or constitutes the resource.

label: Recorder
description: The participant operated the recording machinery used to create the resource.

label: Register
description: Specifies the type of register (any of the varieties of a language that a speaker uses in a particular social context [Merriam-Webster]) of the contents of a language resource

label: Research Participant
description: The participant acted as a research subject or responded to a questionnaire, the results of which study form the basis of the resource.

label: Researcher
description: The resource was created as part of the participant's research, or the research presents interim or final results from the participant's research.

label: Responder
description: The participant was an interlocutor in some sort of discourse event.

label: Signer
description: The participant was a principal signer in a resource that consists of a recording, a film, or a transcription of a recorded resource.

label: Singer
description: The participant sang, either individually or as part of a group, in a resource that consists of a recording, a film, or a transcription of a recorded resource.

label: Speaker
description: The participant was a principal speaker in a resource that consists of a recording, a film, or a transcription of a recorded resource.

label: Sponsor
description: The participant contributed financial support to the creation of the resource.

label: Transcriber
description: The participant produced a transcription of this or a related resource.

label: Translator
description: The participant produced a translation of this or a related resource.
